intro: Saurauia nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar laurel, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various animals. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
